column4: Hello. My screen usually freezes when resuming from a screen saver, but I can switch to cli with cntrl+alt+f#. What can I do to recover the screen?
press Control+Alt+F7
that doesn't help.
log in on the cli and then type "startx"
neither does that
Do you have the kill sequence enabled?
not sure what that is
Keyboard Layout --> Layouts --> Options... --> Key sequence to kill the X server
you mean cntrl+alt+backspace to restart X?
yes, but that logs me out.
enable that and then you can use Control+Alt+Backspace to restart X
it still occurs without screensaver, e.g: closing laptop lid and opening
AMD gpu?
no NVIDIA integrated graphics
you have latest nvidia drivers installed?
afaik, yes.
from what is available in the 11.04 repos
actually I think its not even Nvidia, "Intel Corporation Mobile 4 Series Chipset Memory"
lspci | grep VGA
Intel Corporation Mobile 4 Series Chipset Integrated Graphics Controller
(rev 07)
upgrading to 11.10 might help because of newer drivers
other than that you're probably out of luck
is there a way to change resolution from cli?
